quran.verse: Indeed, Allah is with those who fear Him and those who are doers of good. (16:128)
Verily, with hardship comes ease. (94:6)
And We have certainly created man, and We know what his soul whispers to him. (50:16)
And whoever puts their trust in Allah, He will be sufficient for them. (65:3)
And speak to people kindly. (2:83)
Allah does not burden a soul beyond that it can bear. (2:286)
And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a mercy to the worlds. (21:107)
Indeed, prayer prohibits immorality and wrongdoing. (29:45)
And whoever fears Allah, He will make for him a way out. (65:2)
Indeed, the Hereafter is better for you than the present [life]. (93:4)
Indeed, the human being is in loss, except those who believe and do good deeds. (103:2-3)
Call upon Me; I will respond to you. (40:60)
And seek help through patience and prayer. (2:45)
And lower your wing to the believers who follow you. (26:215)
Indeed, Allah loves those who are constantly repentant. (2:222)
Do not despair of the mercy of Allah. (39:53)
Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds will have gardens beneath which rivers flow. (2:25)
So remember Me; I will remember you. (2:152)
And do good; indeed, Allah loves the doers of good. (2:195)
Verily, the believers are brothers. (49:10)
Indeed, Allah does not change the condition of a people until they change what is in themselves. (13:11)
Every soul will taste death. (3:185)
And hold firmly to the rope of Allah all together and do not become divided. (3:103)
O you who have believed, fear Allah as He should be feared. (3:102)
And establish prayer and give zakah and bow with those who bow [in worship]. (2:43)
And let not hatred of a people prevent you from being just. (5:8)
Indeed, good deeds do away with misdeeds. (11:114)
Whoever does an atom's weight of good will see it. (99:7)
Whoever does an atom's weight of evil will see it. (99:8)
Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful. (2:199)
And those who believe and do righteous deeds, We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow. (4:57)
And the Hereafter is better and more enduring. (87:17)
But Allah is the best of planners. (3:54)
Indeed, Allah loves those who rely upon Him. (3:159)
And they planned, but Allah planned. And Allah is the best of planners. (3:54)
Indeed, the prayer at fixed times has been enjoined upon the believers. (4:103)
And establish prayer for My remembrance. (20:14)
And Allah is with the patient. (2:153)
Indeed, Allah loves the doers of good. (3:134)
Indeed, Allah commands you to render trusts to whom they are due. (4:58)
And whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] himself. (27:92)
Indeed, Allah has purchased from the believers their lives and their properties. (9:111)
And whoever saves one life, it is as if he had saved mankind entirely. (5:32)
And do not kill the soul which Allah has forbidden, except by right. (17:33)
And those who strive for Us - We will surely guide them to Our ways. (29:69)
Indeed, Allah does not like transgressors. (5:87)
So race to [all that is] good. (2:148)
And He found you lost and guided [you]. (93:7)
Indeed, mankind was created anxious. (70:19)

hadith.text: The best of you are those who learn the Quran and teach it. (Bukhari)
Actions are judged by intentions. (Bukhari and Muslim)
The strongest among you is the one who controls his anger. (Bukhari)
None of you truly believes until he loves for his brother what he loves for himself. (Bukhari)
The most beloved of deeds to Allah is that which is continuous, even if it is little. (Bukhari)
A good word is charity. (Bukhari)
Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him speak good or remain silent. (Bukhari and Muslim)
Paradise lies under the feet of mothers. (Nasaâ€™i)
The best among you are those who have the best manners and character. (Bukhari)
Allah does not look at your appearance or wealth, but looks at your hearts and deeds. (Muslim)
The one who seeks knowledge is on a path to Paradise. (Tirmidhi)
The believer is not one who eats his fill while his neighbor goes hungry. (Bukhari)
Do not belittle any good deed, even meeting your brother with a cheerful face. (Muslim)
The most perfect believer in faith is the one with the best manners. (Tirmidhi)
Give glad tidings, and do not scare people away. (Muslim)
Whoever removes a hardship of a believer in this world, Allah will remove a hardship from him on the Day of Judgment. (Muslim)
When a man dies, his deeds come to an end except for three: an ongoing charity, beneficial knowledge, or a righteous child who prays for him. (Muslim)
Kindness is a mark of faith, and whoever is not kind has no faith. (Muslim)
The best charity is that given in secret to the poor. (Bukhari)
Make things easy for people and do not make them difficult. (Bukhari)
Whoever does not show mercy to people, Allah will not show mercy to him. (Muslim)
The strong person is not the one who overcomes others by strength, but the one who controls himself in anger. (Bukhari)
Smiling in the face of your brother is charity. (Tirmidhi)
None of you [truly] believes until I am more beloved to him than his father, his child, and all of mankind. (Bukhari)
Seek knowledge from the cradle to the grave. (Bayhaqi)
He is not a believer whose stomach is filled while his neighbor goes hungry. (Bukhari)
The upper hand is better than the lower hand. (Bukhari)
Do not harm others, and do not accept harm. (Ibn Majah)
Whoever does not thank people has not thanked Allah. (Tirmidhi)
Modesty is a branch of faith. (Muslim)
Feed the hungry, visit the sick, and set free the captives. (Bukhari)
The one who guides to something good has a reward similar to the doer of it. (Muslim)
Whoever is not merciful to people will not be merciful to him by Allah. (Muslim)
If you love someone for the sake of Allah, tell them. (Ahmad)
He who does not show mercy to our young and respect to our elders is not one of us. (Tirmidhi)
The best among you is the one who is best to his family. (Tirmidhi)
Wealth is not in having many possessions, but in contentment of the soul. (Bukhari)
Do not envy one another; do not hate one another; do not turn away from one another. (Muslim)
Allah is gentle and loves gentleness in all matters. (Bukhari)
The world is the believer's prison and the disbeliever's paradise. (Muslim)
Avoid the seven destructive sins. (Bukhari)
Whoever does good deeds, they will be for their own benefit. (Muslim)
The one who repents from sin is like one who did not sin. (Tirmidhi)
Supplication is the essence of worship. (Tirmidhi)
Allah loves those who repent. (Quran 2:222, supporting Hadith)
